Key Match Events: Morocco won 3-0 against Tanzania with goals from Saiss (30'), Ounahi (77'), En-Nesyri (80')
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco have been in mixed form since their incredible World Cup campaign but did begin re-finding their rhythm in the lead-up to this competition with three consecutive wins while remaining unbeaten in their last five games in all competitions.
They beat this opponent fairly convincingly just less than two months ago, and we fancy them to do likewise in this one.
Post-Match Reflections: Morocco have only lifted the AFCON trophy once in their history, back in 1976, but with one of the most impressive lineups on paper, this feels like their moment, and they will be under immense pressure to make a statement against a favourable opponent in their opening match on Wednesday evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tanzania come into this competition ranked 31st among African footballing nations according to FIFA and are the biggest outsiders to qualify for the knockout stages from Group F.

The Taifa Stars earned qualification for the Africa Cup of Nations by securing a heroic 0-0 draw against Algeria in their final qualification match, displaying resilience and determination to frustrate their illustrious opponent and secure the crucial point needed for advancement while holding off Uganda and Niger in the process.
Others: Morocco's head coach Walid Regragui pointed out that he felt that the Atlas Lions were not the favourites to win the AFCON, but they won each of the three proceeding matches against Liberia (3-0), Tanzania (2-0) and Sierra Leone (3-1) last week.
Tanzania have previously participated in the AFCON in 1980 and 2019 editions, and their last stint in the tournament saw them facing defeats in all three of their matches.
